remarks: The Cartesian product of an infinite set with itself is idempotent. This theorem (which is an AC equivalent) provides the basis for infinite cardinal arithmetic.  Proposition 10.40 of [TakeutiZaring] p. 95.  This proof follows as a corollary of ~ infxpen .  (Contributed by NM, 17-Sep-2004.)  (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 9-Mar-2013.)
statement: infxpidm $p |- ( _om ~<_ A -> ( A X. A ) ~~ A ) $.
